content.rendered:
Megan and Jacob sealed the deal with a stylish natural wedding ceremony and reception on The Bridge Building's rooftop.

This fun-loving couple kept their day traditional by deciding to wait until the big moment to see each other. Megan was sure to include something old, borrowed, new and blue; plus a sixpence coin for good luck!

Megan incorporated a first look of her own with her dad, and it was too sweet for words!

Forget Me Not Designs' towering wooden cross was the perfect backdrop for their sentimental ceremony. Plenty of greenery from Vintage Florals was scattered throughout for an effortless, natural feel.

Following, guests made their way to the bar for a cocktail or two and had a blast taking pictures at the photo booth.

A cocktail reception on the rooftop ensued with a variety of delectable bites to keep bellies full. Selections included cranberry bruschetta, margherita flatbread, hot chicken sliders and prosciutto wrapped shrimp.

Megan's most memorable part of the night was her and Jacob's first dance as newlyweds. "It was terrible and so funny," Megan told us.

They chose to dance to "Touching Heaven" by Johnnyswim because "It was an important song in our relationship that helped us feel connected with each other and with God."

After a private last dance, guests sent the couple off through a tunnel of sparklers underneath the Pedestrian Bridge.

Scroll on for more from this stylish natural wedding.

WEDDING DETAILS

Date: February 10, 2019
Bride & Groom: Megan and Jacob
Location: The Bridge Building
Guest Count: 100
Colors: Neutrals & Blue
Photographer: Frame Visuals
Florist: Vintage Florals
Cross: Forget Me Not Designs
Calligraphy: White Ink Calligraphy
Cake: Kaylan's Kreations
Linens: Music City Tents
DJ: DJ Connection
Catering & Bar: The Bridge Building
Production Design: Infinity Hospitality
Planning: Kalyn | IH

excerpt.rendered: A stylish and spiritual wedding at on the rooftop of The Bridge Building.
